title: Happy Birthday Alessandro!
content:
Happy Birthday! How do you cellebrate there? An evening at La Scala with your lovely young lady and a delicious meal afterwards?   
   
ChrisL
author: dezcom

comments.content:
I have been three times at La Scala,   
but only after its rennovation and transferring   
to the new Teatro degli Arcimboldi,   
 [http://www.teatroallascala.org/eng/arcimboldi/index.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125055/http:/www.teatroallascala.org/eng/arcimboldi/index.htm)   
The 3D typography ("Teatro degli Arcimboldi") out of the   
building is designed (I think) with Bruce Rogers' Centaur.   
   
\> How do you cellebrate there?   
A friend from Poland, Dorota, sent me a DVD,   
"Czesc Tereska" ("Hi Teresa").   
 [http://www.iofilm.co.uk/fm/h/hi\_tereska\_2001.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125055/http:/www.iofilm.co.uk/fm/h/hi_tereska_2001.shtml)   
 [http://www.rottentomatoes.com/vine/showthread.php?t=329449](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125055/http:/www.rottentomatoes.com/vine/showthread.php?t=329449)   
I have seen it in Polish, with English subtitles,   
I have seen it at my sister`s, while my sister   
and her family took a walk somewhere on the hills.   
I was fussing, that movie it is romantic but hopeless,   
it is one of the best film I have ever seen.   
I had my birthday cake with all my family,   
a cake with strawberries and slices of banana,   
it was really good.   
   
Today, in the afternoon, I took the bike and went downtown,   
just to buy my favorite tobacco, "Van Nelle."   
There, one the way back, I met my good friend Alberto,   
and it was really nice to talk with him.   
We planned a bike trip (we both ride racing bikes,   
but this year, nor me or him had the time to train).   
   
Here is my grazie, set in Ernesto Hemingway,   
the typeface family I designed for my MA thesis.   
   
AS

Festeggiato! I am glad you enjoyed your day. May you have many more. My daughter just had her 20th birthday last week. We allso watched a DVD (My Big Fat Greek Wedding). It was far less sad and reminded me of my silly upbringing.   
   
I envy you being able to visit La Scala when you wish. I am an opera fanatic. I am studying the role of Giorgio in Bellini's "I Puritani". My wife gave me singing lessons as a birthday present 2 years ago. I am just starting to sing at an age when most people retire from it.   
   
Your "Ernesto Hemingway" is quite free and alive. You should do many more types.   
   
Cia�   
   
Chris
